aws_opsworks_haproxy_layer.description: Provides an OpsWorks HAProxy layer resource.

stack_id.description: The id of the stack the layer will belong to.

stats_password.description: The password to use for HAProxy stats.

name.description: A human-readable name for the layer.

auto_assign_elastic_ips.description: Whether to automatically assign an elastic IP address to the layer's instances.

auto_assign_public_ips.description: For stacks belonging to a VPC, whether to automatically assign a public IP address to each of the layer's instances.

custom_instance_profile_arn.description: The ARN of an IAM profile that will be used for the layer's instances.

custom_security_group_ids.description: Ids for a set of security groups to apply to the layer's instances.

auto_healing.description: Whether to enable auto-healing for the layer.

healthcheck_method.description: HTTP method to use for instance healthchecks. Defaults to "OPTIONS".

healthcheck_url.description: URL path to use for instance healthchecks. Defaults to "/".

install_updates_on_boot.description: Whether to install OS and package updates on each instance when it boots.

instance_shutdown_timeout.description: The time, in seconds, that OpsWorks will wait for Chef to complete after triggering the Shutdown event.

elastic_load_balancer.description: Name of an Elastic Load Balancer to attach to this layer

drain_elb_on_shutdown.description: Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining.

stats_url.description: The HAProxy stats URL. Defaults to "/haproxy?stats".

stats_user.description: The username for HAProxy stats. Defaults to "opsworks".

system_packages.description: Names of a set of system packages to install on the layer's instances.

ebs_volume.description: `ebs_volume` blocks, as described below, will each create an EBS volume and connect it to the layer's instances.

custom_json.description: Custom JSON attributes to apply to the layer.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

mount_point.description: The path to mount the EBS volume on the layer's instances.

size.description: The size of the volume in gigabytes.

number_of_disks.description: The number of disks to use for the EBS volume.

raid_level.description: The RAID level to use for the volume.

type.description: The type of volume to create. This may be `standard` (the default), `io1` or `gp2`.

iops.description: For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.

arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name(ARN) of the layer.
